Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109-1-c Program Statement.
Section
Description
1

(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/24/25, two youth were arguing. Staff separated the youth by
taking one youth outside. The youth that was inside was able to
get outside where a physical altercation took place and one youth
was injured.
Investigation Complainant was contacted via telephone on 07/25/25,
8/15/2025, and 8/19/2025. However, the contact was
unsuccessful.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Beverly House on
7/30/2025. Youth A reported she and Youth B were involved in an
argument that began inside the home. Youth A reported Youth B
taunted her and made comments that triggered her emotionally.
Although she could not recall the exact words Youth B used, she
reported feeling very upset. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to de-escalate the situation by separating them. Youth
A reported Staff 1 escorted her outside and attempted verbal de-
escalation. While outside, Youth A reported hearing Youth B
yelling inside and hearing a commotion near the front door. Youth
A reported Youth B was able to push past Staff 2 and came
directly outside toward her. Youth A reported she and Youth B
punched each other back and forth. Youth A reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 stepped between them, but they continued to hit each
other. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 kept asking them to
stop, but they did not listen. Youth A reported Youth B was
eventually picked up by Belleville law enforcement and
transported to Juvenile Detention Center. Youth A reported feeling
safe at Beverly House and having no current issues with Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at Beverly House on
7/30/2025. Youth B reported she and Youth A argued in the dining
room because Youth A was being rude to her, so she told Youth A
she would beat her up. Youth B reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 made
efforts to verbally de-escalate the situation by reminding them of
the rules about fighting. Youth B reported Staff 2 told her, “I’m not
going to do this today.” However, she and Youth A continued to
argue. Youth B reported Staff 1 immediately intervened by
separating the youth and taking Youth A outside. Youth B reported
2

she remained inside with Staff 2, who attempted to calm her.
Youth B reported she did not want to stay in the house, so she
punched Staff 2 in the face. Youth B reported she was then able
to get outside where Youth A was. Youth B reported both Staff 1
and Staff 2 tried to stop her from fighting Youth A, but she was
upset and wanted to fight. Youth B reported both staff members
attempted to intervene but were unable to stop them. Youth B
reported she and Youth A exchanged punches and eventually
rolled to the ground. While on the ground, Youth B reported Staff 1
and Staff 2 tried to pull them apart but were unsuccessful. Youth B
reported she continued hitting Youth A until Youth A got up and
walked down the street. Youth B reported she was later arrested
by law enforcement and transported to Juvenile Detention Center.
Despite the incident, Youth B reported feeling overall safe in the
home. She also reported that she and Youth A have since talked
about the incident and apologized to each other.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at Beverly House on
08/21/2025. Youth C reported she witnessed the fight between
Youth A and Youth B. Youth C reported Youth B was the
aggressor and charged at Youth A outside the home. Youth C
reported Staff 1 attempted to separate the youth but was not
successful. Youth C reported both Youth A and Youth B continued
to fight. Youth C reported Staff 2 made efforts to verbally de-
escalate the situation but later expressed that she could have
done more to intervene. Youth C reported witnessing Youth B on
top of Youth A on the ground, punching her and attempting to
scratch out Youth A’s eyes. Youth C reported staff allowed the
youth to continue fighting until Youth D intervened and pulled
them apart. Youth C reported Youth B was eventually arrested
and placed at Juvenile Detention Center. Youth C reported that
Youth A was being targeted at the facility and sometimes feels
staff do not address conflict among residents appropriately, often
ignoring the issues. Youth C reported not feeling safe at Beverly
House, stating that staff do not respond to conflict as they should.
She reported that Staff 1 and Staff 2 initially ignored the conflict
between Youth A and Youth B until it escalated.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at Beverly House on
8/21/2025. Youth D reported Youth A had been waiting for Youth
C to return home and had asked Staff 1 and Staff 2 several times
about Youth C’s location. Youth D reported Youth B had taunted
Youth A, and the argument escalated into a physical fight. Youth
D reported Staff 1 had taken Youth A outside. However, Youth B
was able to exit through the front door. Youth D reported Staff 2
had initially been blocking the door, but Youth B pushed past her.
3

Youth D reported Staff 1 tried to stop Youth A from fighting but
was unsuccessful. Youth D reported both youth continued to fight.
Youth D reported that after seeing Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempt to
separate the youth while they were on the ground, she heard Staff
1 say, “Forget it, let them fight,” and walked away. Youth D
reported she saw scratches on Youth B’s face.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 8/18/2025. Staff 1
reported she had been present during the day of the incident and
was in the kitchen with Youth A when the argument began. Staff 1
reported Youth A indicated to her that there was tension between
her and Youth B. Staff 1 reported that later in the day, she
observed Youth B mocking Youth A for wanting to check on Youth
C. Staff 1 reported that once she observed Youth A become
upset, she separated both youth and took Youth A outside. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 and Youth B remained inside the home. However,
Staff 1 reported hearing Youth B screaming. Staff 1 reported she
heard Staff 2 try to verbally de-escalate Youth B, but Youth B did
not stop and pushed past Staff 2 in an effort to get out of the
house. Staff 1 reported both girls made contact with each other
and began to fight. Staff 1 reported making several attempts to
stop the youth from fighting by standing between them. Once the
youth fell to the ground, she tried to separate them but they would
not stop. Staff 1 reported the youth continued fighting despite her
and Staff 2’s efforts to intervene.
Staff 1 reported stepping away to notify her supervisor and law
enforcement. She reported contacting law enforcement several
times before they arrived. Staff 1 reported Youth B was arrested
and placed at the Juvenile Detention Center for one night. Staff 1
reported no youth were harmed during the incident; however, Staff
2 was injured.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 8/13/2025. Staff 2
reported she was present when the incident occurred. Staff 2
reported Youth A and Youth B were in the kitchen talking when
she overheard Youth B question Youth A’s sexuality. Staff 2
reported this triggered Youth A, and she observed Youth A take
off her shoes, so she asked Staff 1 to take Youth A outside in an
effort to separate the youth.
Once Youth A was outside, Staff 2 and Youth B remained inside
the home. Staff 2 reported making efforts to intervene by standing
at the front door; however, Youth B would not stop screaming at
4

Youth A. Staff 2 reported trying to de-escalate Youth B, but Youth
B refused to listen.
Staff 2 reported Youth A punched Staff 2 in the face and left the
house. Staff 2 reported going outside and finding Youth A and
Youth B on the side of the house. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1
got between the youth to prevent them from fighting. However,
Youth A and Youth B exchanged punches.
Staff 2 reported being trained in behavior management but noted
that employees were not allowed to restrain youth, so after verbal
tactics were used, law enforcement was contacted. Staff 2
reported she and Staff 1 called law enforcement several times
before assistance arrived.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was arrested and taken to Juvenile
Detention Center.
Supervisor and Therapist were interviewed face to face on
7/30/2025 at Beverly House.
Supervisor reported having no concerns with the conduct of Staff
1 and Staff 2 regarding their interactions with youth in the home.
Supervisor stated that Staff 1 and Staff 2 contacted her
immediately when the altercation between Youth A and Youth B
began. She reported ongoing issues with Law Enforcement’s
delayed response to calls. Supervisor confirmed that staff are not
permitted to use physical restraints and stated that Staff 1 and
Staff 2 made active efforts to stop the fight but were ultimately
unsuccessful.
Therapist also reported no concerns with the conduct of Staff 1 or
Staff 2. Therapist noted that neither Youth A nor Youth B
expressed concerns about staff supervision or intervention during
the incident. Therapist acknowledged being aware of ongoing
conflict between the two youth and confirmed that staff used
verbal de-escalation tactics to intervene, though these efforts are
not always effective—particularly because the youth are aware
that physical restraint is not permitted.
Video Reviewed: Audio Available – Dated 7/24/2025 at
9:20pm- Beverly House Side Door Camera.
Youth A was seen standing outside at the beginning of this 4-
minute and 5-second video. No staff were visible with Youth A at
this point. At the 56-second mark, Youth B was heard yelling,
5

“Stop, stop.” Youth B was then seen approaching Youth A, saying,
“I’ll fuck you up.”
Staff 1 and Staff 2 approached Youth A along with Youth B and
Youth C. A staff member was heard saying, “You should have
gone in the house like I told you.” Youth A responded, “She ain’t
going to do nothing.” A staff member was heard saying, “Leave
her alone,” as Youth A moved closer to Youth B.
A staff member was seen positioning themselves between the two
youth outside, trying to keep them apart, but Youth A and Youth B
kept moving forward. Youth A was able to punch Youth B in the
face. A staff member was heard yelling, “Stop.” Youth B
responded, “Come on, ho,” as she threw another punch at Youth
A.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 moved with the youth, attempting to get
between them, but the two youth began grabbing and punching
each other. Staff 1 and Staff 2 stood back slightly and tried to pull
the youth apart but did not find an opportunity to do so without
risking getting hit. From 1:27 to 1:41, the youth were seen
punching each other with no intervention.
Youth B was able to wrestle Youth A down to the ground near the
back facility van. A staff member was heard saying, “Hold my
phone,” as she tried to intervene. Youth A was seen on top of
Youth B, grabbing her hair and pulling her down.
A staff member grabbed Youth A and yelled, “Stop, cut it out,” but
the two youth would not let go of each other. Youth B then climbed
on top of Youth A and proceeded to hit her. Both staff hovered
over the youth, making efforts to separate them.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 continued trying to separate the two youth, but
they still would not release each other. Staff 2 reached down to
pull them apart. Youth A yelled, “Get off of me,” while Youth B
shouted, “Get off of me, bitch.”
One staff member was heard saying, “Let them fight,” as she
walked away. Youth B was seen punching Youth A as the staff
member walked away. The video ended with Youth C, Youth D,
and a staff member standing nearby, watching Youth B on the
ground as Youth A punched her.
Documents Reviewed:
6

Staff Files: Per Division Director, there is no discipline records for
Staff 1 and Staff 2 on file. Staff 1 did not complete Non-Violent
Crisis Physical Intervention (CPI training) and is scheduled to
complete in September. Staff 2 completed Non-Violent Crisis
Physical Intervention (CPI) training on 11/12/24.
Unusual Incident Report for Youth B 07/24/2025 authored by
Staff 2 and Supervisor. Incident Report is consistent with all
interviews.
Behavior Management Philosophy: Spectrum staff must use
de-escalation techniques to present behavior management, which
is only used to keep everyone safe. If needed, law enforcement
will be contacted. Approved methods include time-outs and non-
physical interventions.
Supervision and Security Policy:
Mental Health Behavioral Stabilization (MHBS) Program
MHBS sites have 24/7 direct care staff who maintain line of sight
and proper staff-to-consumer ratios. Staff monitor youth behavior,
daily routines, and safety, ensuring all youth are accounted for.
Safety plans for at-risk youth are created, reviewed, and followed
by the team. In emergencies, police are contacted and missing
youth reports are filed immediately. Staff follow universal
precautions and keep the environment safe and clean. Emergency
contacts are always accessible. The MHBS team documents
incidents and receives ongoing training in crisis prevention and
intervention.
Behavior Management Policy & Procedures:
POLICY:
It is the policy of the Residential Programs do not use corporal
punishment or physical restraint. Youth Residential Services
stress the importance of attempting to employ verbal de-
escalation as a first response to physically aggressive behavior.
Staff will utilize approved crisis prevention techniques, i.e.,
prevention, de-escalation techniques, escorting, and non-violent
responses to assaultive behavior, which includes a trauma-
informed approach. If such efforts are ineffective local law
enforcement is contacted.
PROCEDURE(S): Spectrum doesn’t use corporal punishment,
seclusion, and do not use any physical management unless in an
extreme emergency situation.
7

All employees receive initial and ongoing Non-Violent Crisis
Physical Intervention (CPI) training. Spectrum staff use conflict
resolution and crisis prevention to avoid formal behavior
management, which is only used to ensure consumer safety.
Spectrum does not use corporal punishment or physical restraint.
Behavior management emphasizes consumer rights and positive
programming to support growth. When preventive measures fail,
local law enforcement is contacted. Authorized techniques include
time-outs (non-restrictive and voluntary), non-physical
interventions, clear communication of expectations, positive
reinforcement, non-verbal cues, and physical proximity to redirect
behavior. Time-outs are brief, voluntary breaks from the group,
limited to 15 minutes and twice per day, aimed at helping youth
develop self-management skills.
Analysis The agency was found to be in non-compliance based on video
review. Staff 1 failed to utilize effective verbal de-escalation
techniques and was observed stating, "let them fight." Additionally,
Staff 1 had not received the training required by the agency’s
policy. These failures contributed to a prolonged physical
altercation between Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
